result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy D. Clanton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Billy D. Clanton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Billy D. Clanton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with Mandi B unless otherwise permitted by the agent. Deft not to move out of WI until after he takes Circle of Change, Anger Management & Batterers treatment.  Any contact with his children should be supervised, not by the mother but by someone who is trustworthy and truthful an only after Mandi B provides her valid address.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to 16CF351; deft to pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs in this file and in 16CF351, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  No contact w/Mandi B. unless approved by agent after he completes Circle of Change, anger management and batterers treatment; deft is not to move out of WI unless approved by agent after he completes Circle of Change, anger management and batterers treatment; any contact with his children should be supervised, not by the mother but by someone who is trustworthy and truthful and only after Mandi B provides her valid address.  Deft to report to court by 5pm this date of his address.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Atty Ekes states he just received the PSI today, needs time to review it with the deft.  SEH is adjourned to 3/31/17 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/27/17 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JS set for 1/23/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski states he will be returning the file to the PD office for another appointment.  STC 7/21/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court contacts Atty Bielski by phone and he was not aware of the court date, has not received appointment paperwork yet.  STC continued to 7/5/16 at 2:45pm.  Bond continued.
Atty  D Bielski.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards motion to withdraw.  Court grants motion.  JS of 6/27/16 is changed to a STC; deft to report to PD office to obtain new counsel.  Bond continued.
to withdraw as counsel; filed by Atty H Edwards.
